description: Meeting prioritization and calendar scheduling preferences. Uses LAB colorspace for perceptually uniform urgency and priority metrics.

transform.notes: LAB provides perceptually uniform distances for priority/urgency metrics in meeting scheduling

L.label: Meeting Priority
L.description: Overall importance from low-priority (0) to critical (100)
L.interpretation: Higher values indicate meetings that should take precedence in scheduling conflicts

a.label: Time Sensitivity
a.description: Time-sensitivity axis from flexible scheduling (negative) to immediate/time-critical (positive)
a.interpretation: Negative: can be rescheduled, flexible timing. Positive: fixed deadline, time-sensitive.

b.label: Collaboration Scope
b.interpretation: Negative: individual meetings, 1:1s, focused work. Positive: large groups, cross-team, broad stakeholders.

anchors.label: Routine Team Check-in
anchors.description: Regular recurring meeting, low urgency, flexible scheduling
anchors.semantic_context: Weekly sync, standup, routine status update

anchors.label: Planning/Strategy Session
anchors.description: Important but not urgent, collaborative, requires dedicated time
anchors.semantic_context: Quarterly planning, roadmap review, strategic discussion

anchors.label: 1:1 Meeting
anchors.description: Individual meeting, moderate priority, flexible timing

anchors.label: Deadline-Driven Review
anchors.semantic_context: Pre-launch review, release approval, time-boxed decision

anchors.label: Urgent Decision Meeting
anchors.description: High priority, time-critical, requires immediate action
anchors.semantic_context: Production incident, customer escalation, urgent approval needed

anchors.label: Crisis/Emergency Response
anchors.description: Critical priority, immediate action required, all-hands mobilization
anchors.semantic_context: System outage, security incident, major customer issue

anchors.label: Executive Strategic Meeting
anchors.description: High priority, collaborative, scheduled well in advance
anchors.semantic_context: Board meeting, executive offsite, major stakeholder alignment

quality_config.notes: Moderate thresholds - meeting scheduling can tolerate some uncertainty but should flag edge cases

confidence_factors.notes: Balanced weighting appropriate for business process automation

compliance_notes: Enable audit trails for calendar systems to track meeting prioritization decisions and scheduling conflicts.

not_suitable_for: External customer meetings (may need separate schema)
Time zone coordination (use structured datetime data)
usage_guidelines.integration_notes: Combine with calendar metadata (attendee count, duration, recurrence) for complete scheduling intelligence.

scheduling_logic.conflict_resolution: Higher priority_level wins. If tied, higher urgency_score wins. If still tied, prefer earlier scheduled.
scheduling_logic.notification_urgency: urgency_score > 50: immediate notification. 0-50: batched digest. < 0: no notification.
scheduling_logic.reschedule_flexibility: urgency_score < -30: highly flexible. -30 to 30: moderate flexibility. > 30: avoid rescheduling.
scheduling_logic.buffer_time: priority_level > 70: add 15min buffer before/after. < 30: no buffer needed.

example_interpretations.description: Critical crisis requiring immediate all-hands response
example_interpretations.action: Override all conflicts, send immediate notifications, block calendar

example_interpretations.description: Important planning session, flexible scheduling, moderate collaboration
example_interpretations.action: Schedule in advance, protect time but allow reschedule with notice

example_interpretations.description: Routine check-in with neutral priority and flexibility
example_interpretations.action: Standard scheduling, can be moved if conflicts arise

calendar_api.description: Map VRGB priority to calendar event properties
